overview_summary: None of the five profiled neighboring landowners have a noted public stance on the proposed development or clean energy (all are classified as 'unknown' stance). Their community influence is uniformly low, with no high-profile local figures identified among these neighbors.

neighbors.name: Thelma Hughes & Donna Sullivan
neighbors.claims: The land is held under a life estate deed by Thelma Hughes, indicating an intention to keep the property in the family while avoiding probate [Provident Law](https://www.provident.law/post/alabama-life-estate-deeds-a-complete-guide-to-how-they-work-pros-and-cons-and-when-to-use-them). No records of Hughes or Sullivan participating in local meetings or expressing views on development were found [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx).
neighbors.influence_justification: Aging private landowner; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Donna Sullivan (younger family), emphasizing respect for the family’s land legacy and how any project can honor their long-term heritage.

neighbors.name: Leon & Gail Wade
neighbors.claims: Leon Wade (born 1933) was a longtime local resident; he passed away in 2004 at age 71 [AL.com (Huntsville)](https://obits.al.com/us/obituaries/huntsville/name/leon-wade-obituary?id=35387021). His widow, Gail Wade, now holds the property, and there are no public reports of her taking any stance or active role regarding development issues [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to Gail in person with a respectful, neighborly approach—acknowledging Leon’s legacy on the land and patiently listening to any concerns she may have.

neighbors.name: Henry R. Williams Jr.
neighbors.claims: Henry R. Williams Jr. owns land in Flat Rock but has no documented involvement in local public affairs or organizations [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx). No records indicate any statements or positions by Williams Jr. on development or energy projects in the community [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Williams privately through a casual, one-on-one conversation since he is not publicly engaged, and be prepared to address basic questions about how the project might affect his property.

neighbors.name: Cynthia Scruggs
neighbors.claims: Cynthia Scruggs is a local landowner with no evident public roles or civic profile in Jackson County [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx). Her name does not appear in local government minutes or news reports, and there is no record of her voicing any opinions on development proposals [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact directly and politely (e.g., a phone call or visit) since she keeps a low profile, and be ready to listen to any personal concerns she might raise about changes in the area.

neighbors.name: Phillip Lansin & Sherrie Craig
neighbors.claims: Phillip Lansin Craig Jr. (age 40) and Sherrie Craig reside on County Road 814 in Flat Rock [Offender Radar](https://www.offenderradar.com/offender-details/phillip-lansin-craig-jr-of-alabama-1092459). They have not been active in any public meetings or local media; there are no records of the Craig family expressing views or concerns about development plans in the community [Jackson County Records Archive](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/Archive.aspx).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Craigs with a straightforward, informational approach. Given their lack of public involvement, provide clear details on how the project might benefit or protect their property and be open to answering their questions.
